data.title: CRWV Earnings: CoreWeave Stock Drops on Wider-than-Expected Q4 Loss
data.description:
AI and cloud-computing company CoreWeave (CRWV) stock was down over 6% in after-hours trading after reporting fourth-quarter results.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

The company posted a loss of $0.89 per share, which was much wider than the loss of $0.50 expected on Wall Street. A year earlier, CoreWeave reported a loss of $0.08 per share. Meanwhile, Q4 revenue surged 110.2% year-over-year to $1.57 billion, beating the consensus estimate of $1.53 billion.

Profitability Pressured as CoreWeave Scales

The company's rapid expansion continues to weigh on margins. Operating expenses more than doubled to $5.18 billion for the year, resulting in a full‑year operating loss of $46 million, compared with a $324 million operating profit in 2024.

Adjusted net loss for 2025 totaled $606 million, versus $65 million in the year-ago quarter, reflecting higher interest expense tied to CoreWeave's aggressive build‑out of AI data centers.

Massive $66.8B Revenue Backlog

Importantly, CoreWeave's revenue backlog surged to $66.8 billion, more than 4 times higher than where it started the year. CFO Nitin Agrawal said the backlog gives the company "exceptional visibility" as it scales into 2026 and beyond.

This backlog includes long‑term commitments from AI labs, hyperscalers, and large enterprises, many of whom are racing to secure GPU capacity amid unprecedented demand for AI compute.

Is CoreWeave a Good Stock to Buy?

Turning to Wall Street, CRWV stock has a Moderate Buy consensus rating based on nine Buy and eight Hold ratings. The average CoreWeave stock price target of $118.57 implies 20.72% upside potential.  It's worth noting that estimates will likely change following today's earnings report.
data.author: Radhika Saraogi

data.title: "Stunning" Film Studio Revival, More Planned, Warner Bros. Discovery (NASDAQ:WBD) Stock Slips Regardless
data.description:
Entertainment giant Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) has not yet been purchased by a different studio. As such, it continues to run like a business should, and recently offered up some commentary about its prospects in the near future. It also showed off its quarterly numbers, which left some investors a bit displeased. Warner shares dropped fractionally in the closing minutes of Thursday's trading.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Naturally, the biggest question from investors was who was going to buy Warner. Warner executives did not rush to answer that question, but instead presented a look at what was likely to be coming in the near future. One of the big points was the future of the Warner cable channels. From CNN to TNT to Discovery and the rest, Warner declared that the spinoff was going well. In fact, HBO was looking forward to around 10 years' worth of marketing coming up as the Harry Potter series started up.

Gaming, meanwhile, would take a bit of a backseat for a while, Expensive flops like Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League proved to be a problem. Warner's gaming got "…distracted going after too many IP with too broad a set of studios." But the real win would be the film studios, which were poised for a "stunning" year going into 2027. Warner managed to land nine major hits in the last 14 months, reports noted.

But Then The Numbers Hit

Even as Warner made it clear its future looked great, its fourth quarter of 2025 figures were a bit of a downer. Warner posted total revenue of $9.46 billion, and boasted 131.6 million subscribers on its HBO Max operations. Yet, despite all that, Warner still managed to post a quarterly loss of $252 million.

Overall revenue was also down, about 6% against 2024's fourth quarter. Advertising revenue dropped 9%, and half of that loss went to the loss of the NBA broadcasts on its own. Global linear networks dropped another 12%, which makes it abundantly clear why Warner is looking to spin them off, and may also explain why valuing the linear channels has proven to be such a sticking point lately.

Is WBD Stock a Good Buy?

Turning to Wall Street, analysts have a Moderate Buy consensus rating on WBD stock based on four Buys and eight Holds assigned in the past three months, as indicated by the graphic below. After a 162.73% rally in its share price over the past year, the average WBD price target of $29.66 per share implies 2.9% upside potential.
data.author: Steve Anderson

data.title: Stock Market Today: SPY, QQQ Dragged Down by Nvidia amid 'Positive' U.S.-Iran Talks
data.description:
The S&P 500 ETF (SPY) and the Nasdaq 100 ETF (QQQ) closed lower on Thursday, although both ETFs staged partial recoveries from their intraday lows.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Despite a double beat on both revenue and earnings, Nvidia (NVDA) ended the day with a 5.49% loss. NVDA is the largest holding in both SPY and QQQ with weights of 7.83% and 8.90%, respectively.

  • Revenue: $68.13 billion vs. $66.21 billion estimated
  • Data center revenue: $62.3 billion vs. $60.69 billion estimated
  • Adjusted EPS: $1.62 vs. $1.53 estimated
  • Fiscal First-Quarter Guidance: $78 billion plus or minus 2% vs est. $72.6 billion

The semiconductor leader's results weren't enough to ward off fears of an AI bubble, high customer concentration, and the sustainability of investments in AI. In addition, investors zoned in on Nvidia's purchase commitments, which rose by 90.2% quarter-over-quarter to $95.2 billion.

"The debate has shifted away from near-term results and toward the sustainability of AI capex spending, amid concerns around its quantum, monetization and potential cashflow degradation," said Janus Henderson portfolio manager Richard Clode.

Meanwhile, the U.S. and Iran held indirect nuclear talks in Geneva, with a senior U.S. official describing them as "positive." Omani Foreign Minister Badr al-Busaidi added that the two sides made "significant progress," with technical talks scheduled in Vienna next week. At the same time, key disagreements remain, with the U.S. calling on Iran to eliminate its 10,000-kilogram stockpile of enriched uranium. Iran rejected this proposal and pushed for low enrichment levels monitored by the International Atomic Energy Agency.

Before the market opened, the Department of Labor announced that initial jobless claims for the week ended February 21 rose by 4,000 to 212,000, below the consensus estimate of 216,000. Continuing jobless claims, which trail initial claims by a week, fell by 31,000 to 1.833 million and undershot expectations of 1.858 million. Initial jobless claims track new layoffs, while continuing claims reflect the level of ongoing unemployment.

Finally, the Trump administration is weighing its options to retain tariff revenue collected under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA), according to Politico. Several options are on the table, including a proposal that contends tariffs collected over the past year comply with a new set of duties the administration is now implementing under different legal frameworks. Another option would allow companies to move to the front of the refund line by agreeing to forfeit part of the money to the government. Thousands of companies have already filed lawsuits seeking refunds, including Costco (COST) and FedEx (FDX).

The S&P 500 (SPX) closed with a 0.54% loss, while the Nasdaq 100 (NDX) fell by 1.16%.
data.author: Eddie Pan

data.title: Ford Stock (NYSE:F) Ticks Down as "Uptime Assist" Takes Hold
data.description:
In the closing days of 2025, legacy automaker Ford (F) rolled out a new tool designed to get cars repaired faster, a move that most would welcome. It was known as Uptime Assist, and reports note that it is starting to catch on more fully. But even as Ford offered a powerful new tool to dealerships, investors remained concerned. Ford shares dipped fractionally in Thursday afternoon's trading.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

While Uptime Assist has not been in place for very long, it is producing some exciting results. Reports suggest that Uptime Assist has cut repair times by between 10% and 15%. This means time and money saved for customers, particularly those who own and manage fleets. Ford dealerships already carry out 35 million repairs a year as it is, so improvements of even seconds will save huge volumes of cumulative man-hours.

Ford is still pushing toward a goal of same-day customer repairs. Though it is not there yet, reports note it is closing in. One key feature allows dealerships to call for help from Ford itself, seeking additional technical support or parts ordering assistance. Ford is actively notified if a repair ever takes longer than two days.

The Renegades of Frunk

Those interested in getting a front trunk—a frunk—for their Mustang Mach-E will need to pay more for the privilege, reports note. A frunk is now an optional feature on the Mach-E, which will cost customers $495 to have included.

Ford decided to charge for it because, apparently, customers were not particularly interested in this block of empty space. Thus, Ford cut it as a standard feature, allowing it to stay as a paid option. Response to this notion has been mixed, with some wondering why they now need to pay to make a section of space that was really only usable for storage actually usable for storage.

Is Ford Stock a Good Buy Right Now?

Turning to Wall Street, analysts have a Hold consensus rating on F stock based on two Buys, 12 Holds and one Sell assigned in the past three months, as indicated by the graphic below. After a 55.33% rally in its share price over the past year, the average F price target of $13.88 per share implies 3.78% downside risk.
data.author: Steve Anderson

data.title: Intel Stock (NASDAQ:INTC) Plunges After Key Figure Loss
data.description:
Bad news hit chip stock Intel (INTC), as one of its biggest names in the foundry operation has departed the company for a job at Qualcomm (QCOM) instead. Kevin O'Buckley, former senior vice president and general manager of Intel Foundry Services, is now Qualcomm's vice president of global operations and supply chain. This news hit investors like a bus, and Intel shares bled out nearly 3.5% of their value in Thursday afternoon's trading.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Intel, perhaps as a kind of damage control, noted that Intel Foundry remains "…one of Intel's highest strategic priorities." Further, Intel looks for Intel Foundry to remain "…focused on disciplined execution and delivering for customers" under the new leadership of Naga Chandrasekaran, who took over the top slot therein last year.

Meanwhile, Intel thanked O'Buckley for his service, wishing him "the very best" as he took on his new role. Why O'Buckley left is not immediately clear. Some note that O'Buckley formerly reported to Lip-Bu Tan himself, but with the changes to Intel Foundry, would report to Chandrasekaran instead. The idea of no longer having access to the top might have rankled O'Buckley, but that is strictly speculative.

A New Battle With Nvidia

While it would be safe to say that Nvidia (NVDA) has a vested interest in Intel's success—especially given the $5 billion investment it made in Intel back in December—it also has a vested interest in beating Intel. Nvidia is out to branch out into the CPU market, a decidedly different market from the GPU that it commonly handles.

CPUs are making a comeback, reports note, with artificial intelligence (AI) companies moving from training models to deploying them instead. That typically calls for CPU power, and Nvidia wants to be in the thick of that market, offering up its own breed of CPU to take advantage of the "dance with the one who brought you" market.

Is Intel a Buy, Hold or Sell?

Turning to Wall Street, analysts have a Hold consensus rating on INTC stock based on eight Buys, 21 Holds and four Sells assigned in the past three months, as indicated by the graphic below. After a 103.03% rally in its share price over the past year, the average INTC price target of $48.21 per share implies 6.67% upside potential.
data.author: Steve Anderson

data.title: Ransomware Surges 49% as AI Makes Cyberattacks Faster and Easier, IBM Says
data.description:
Tech giant IBM (IBM) has released its 2026 X-Force Threat Intelligence Index, and the main takeaway is concerning: cybercriminals are increasingly taking advantage of simple security mistakes, and artificial intelligence is helping them do it faster. According to the report, attacks that start through public-facing websites or apps jumped 44%, largely because companies failed to require proper logins or protections. In fact, exploiting software vulnerabilities became the number-one way hackers break in, accounting for 40% of incidents in 2025.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Interestingly, IBM says that attackers are not inventing brand-new methods, but instead are using AI to speed up old tactics. At the same time, ransomware attacks, where criminals lock systems and demand payment, are becoming more common and more chaotic. IBM found that the number of active ransomware groups rose 49% from the previous year, while reported victims increased by about 12%. Much of this growth comes from smaller criminal groups using stolen hacking tools and step-by-step guides, which makes it easier for newcomers to launch attacks.

Meanwhile, AI services themselves are becoming targets. In 2025, malware exposed more than 300,000 ChatGPT login credentials, which could allow attackers to manipulate responses, steal sensitive data, or inject malicious instructions. In addition, attacks on supply chains and partner systems are rising sharply. Large breaches involving third-party software providers have nearly quadrupled since 2020. Experts also warn that poorly reviewed AI-assisted code may increase this risk if it makes its way into real systems. The report also found that manufacturing was the most targeted industry, making up 27.7% of incidents.

Is IBM a Buy, Sell, or Hold?

Turning to Wall Street, analysts have a Moderate Buy consensus rating on IBM stock based on 12 Buys, six Holds, and zero Sells assigned in the past three months, as indicated by the graphic below. Furthermore, the average IBM price target of $334.18 per share implies 37.8% upside potential.
data.author: Vince Condarcuri

data.title: Boeing Stock (NYSE:BA) Slips Despite African Gains
data.description:
Admittedly, most of us do not consider Africa as a major market for aircraft. However, aerospace stock Boeing (BA) thinks that there is no shortage of opportunity on the continent, and offered up a new outlook on potential sales therein. It looks for a major increase in aircraft sold, and upgraded its aircraft order outlook fully 40%. Investors seemed skeptical as well, and sent shares slipping fractionally in Thursday afternoon's trading.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Boeing now expects to sell 1,700 planes in Africa over the next 20 years, reports note, which is up substantially from previous forecasts of 1,000 just three years ago. These forecasts were already upgraded once, going from 1,000 to 1,200 last year.

Boeing Africa Plc's managing director Henok Teferra Shawl noted, "Africa is growing very rapidly economically and that directly translates into air travel growth." On that point, Shawl is clearly correct. Sub-Saharan Africa is set to see its economic output grow about 4.6%, as compared with the 3.3% expected by the rest of the world. As it turns out, Africa is home to a growing middle class and a surprisingly young population, both of which are excellent factors for growth in air travel demand.

Another New Competitor

Boeing has long benefited from being part of an effective duopoly. Other firms have tried to enter the market, but are basically niche firms at best. But one more, Natilus, is looking to enter the market and produce what it hopes will be the "next chapter" of aviation.

Natilus recently showed off what it has in mind: a triangular aircraft that is a far cry from the tube with wings that Boeing typically releases. Natilus' design requires 30% less fuel than a standard design, which reduces operating costs by half, reports note. And given the backlogs at both Boeing and immediate competitor Airbus (EADSY), the end result is a potential winner, assuming it can be produced at sufficient scale.

Is Boeing a Good Stock to Buy Right Now?

Turning to Wall Street, analysts have a Strong Buy consensus rating on BA stock based on 13 Buys and one Hold assigned in the past three months, as indicated by the graphic below. After a 32.52% rally in its share price over the past year, the average BA price target of $278.17 per share implies 21.77% upside potential.
data.author: Steve Anderson

data.title: Mortgage Rates Sink Below 6% For First Time Since 2022
data.description:
The average 30-year fixed-rate mortgage rate in the U.S. has fallen below 6% for the first time since September 2022. The rate sits at 5.98%, down from 6.01% in the prior week and 6.76% a year ago, according to data from Freddie Mac (FMCC) released on Thursday.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Real estate experts note that mortgage rates in the psychological 5% range could attract more buyers into the market and result in higher demand for refinancing. The lower rates arrive just ahead of spring, a period that typically sees increased home-buying activity. "With a sub-6% rate, we'll get reliable sales growth across the country," said Compass Chief Economist Mike Simonsen.

Higher Costs May Limit Housing Demand

Others aren't so sure that lower rates will lead to higher demand. Whelan Advisory CEO Margaret Whelan notes that consumer sentiment remains subdued alongside a labor market that has shown signs of weakening. In addition, both electricity and home insurance costs have risen, making it more expensive to own a home.

Economists expect rates to stay in the high 5% to low 6% range for the remainder of the year. Fannie Mae (FNMA) expects an average rate of 6%, while the Mortgage Bankers Association predicts a 6.1% rate.
data.author: Eddie Pan

data.title: XAIX, AGIX: Two Best Artificial Intelligence (AI) ETFs to Buy Now
data.description:
Xtrackers Artificial Intelligence & Big Data ETF (XAIX) and KraneShares Artificial Intelligence & Technology ETF (AGIX) are two AI‑focused ETFs ideal for investors seeking exposure to the sector.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions

Both offer access to companies driving the AI boom, but they take very different paths. One uses a broad index approach, while the other blends public and private companies to capture some of the emerging players in the space.

Let's take a deeper look at these two ETFs.

Xtrackers Artificial Intelligence & Big Data ETF (XAIX)

The XAIX ETF tracks the Nasdaq Global Artificial Intelligence and Big Data Index, giving investors diversified exposure to companies involved in deep learning, NLP, image recognition, cloud computing, big data, and cybersecurity.

The ETF is ideal for investors who want broad, liquid, low‑cost exposure to the global AI ecosystem, especially the large‑cap names driving today's AI infrastructure and software boom.

Some of the top holdings in the XAIX ETF include Nvidia (NVDA), Micron (MU), and Alibaba (BABA). Overall, the ETF has $108.25 million in assets under management (AUM) and an expense ratio of 0.35%. Over the past six months, the XAIX ETF has generated a return of 10.28%.

On TipRanks, XAIX has a Moderate Buy consensus rating based on 62 Buys and 20 Holds assigned in the last three months. At $54.35, the average XAIX ETF price target implies 28.10% upside potential.
data.author: Radhika Saraogi

data.title: How Norway's $2T Wealth Fund Uses Anthropic to Screen Its Invstments
data.description:
Norway's massive wealth fund, worth about $2 trillion, says it is now using artificial intelligence to screen companies for reputational and ethical risks before investing. The fund is managed by Norges Bank Investment Management (NBIM) and was created in the 1990s to invest profits from Norway's oil and gas industry. Today, it owns stakes in more than 7,200 companies across 60 countries, equal to roughly 1.5% of all publicly traded stocks worldwide.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Interestingly, it now uses Anthropic's AI tools to scan large volumes of public information and deliver governance and sustainability insights to portfolio managers. More specifically, these tools can flag potential risks within 24 hours of a new investment, such as links to forced labor, corruption, or fraud, even if major news outlets have not reported them yet. In some cases, the fund was able to sell investments before the broader market reacted, thereby helping it avoid losses.

However, the fund's ethical decisions have also caused controversy. For example, last year it sold shares in companies such as Caterpillar (CAT) and several Israeli banks, which drew criticism from U.S. officials who questioned the reasoning behind the move. Norway's finance minister insisted that the decision was not political, but the backlash led to temporary changes to how companies can be excluded while the ethical framework was reviewed. Nevertheless, NBIM claims that sustainability and governance risks are closely tied to long-term financial performance.

Claude Investors Have Seen Huge Gains

Anthropic investors have seen huge gains during the past few months as the company's valuation has increased from $183 billion to $380 billion. Meanwhile, the company has raised billions of dollars to continue funding its impressive growth.
data.author: Vince Condarcuri
